title: Wikiwand - Anthroposophic medicine
description: Anthroposophic medicine is a form of alternative medicine based on pseudoscientific and occult notions. Devised in the 1920s by Rudolf Steiner in conjunction with Ita Wegman , anthroposophical medicine draws on Steiner's spiritual philosophy, which he called anthroposophy. Practitioners employ a variety of treatment techniques based upon anthroposophic precepts, including massage, exercise, counselling, and substances.

Summarize this article for a 10 years old Anthroposophic medicine (or anthroposophical medicine) is a form of [alternative medicine](/en/Alternative_medicine) based on [pseudoscientific](/en/Pseudoscience) and [occult](/en/Occult) notions. [[1]](#cite_note-teils-1) Devised in the 1920s in Steiner's [spiritual philosophy](/en/Spiritual_philosophy), which he called [anthroposophy](/en/Anthroposophy). Practitioners employ a variety of treatment techniques based upon anthroposophic precepts, including [massage](/en/Massage), exercise, [counselling](/en/Counseling_psychology), and substances. [[2]](#cite_note-ernstmist-2) |Part of |[Anthroposophy](/en/Anthroposophy) Many drug preparations used in anthroposophic medicine are ultra-diluted substances, similar to those used in [homeopathy](/en/Homeopathy). Homeopathic remedies are not medically effective and are generally considered harmless, except when used as a substitute for a scientifically proven and effective prevention and cure. [[3]](#cite_note-krit-3) In certain European countries, people with [cancer](/en/Cancer) are sometimes prescribed remedies made from specially harvested [mistletoe](/en/Mistletoe), although no [evidence](/en/Evidence-based_medicine) of clinical benefit exists. [[4]](#cite_note-ACS-4) [[5]](#cite_note-coch-2010-5) Some anthroposophic doctors oppose childhood [vaccination](/en/Vaccination), and this has led to preventable outbreaks of disease. [[6]](#cite_note-measles-6) Anthroposophic medicine departs from fundamental biological, physical and chemical principles in several respects. For example, Steiner said that the [heart](/en/Heart) is not a [pump](/en/Pump), but that the blood in a sense pumps itself. [[7]](#cite_note-7) [[8]](#cite_note-Marinelli-8) Anthroposophic medicine also proposes that patients' [past lives](/en/Past_lives) may influence their illness and that the course of an illness is subject to [karmic](/en/Karmic) destiny.
